definition: to dazzle/to boast/to show off/(slang) cool/awesome

sentences.english: Dazzle her with these one of a kind sapphire and diamond earrings.
sentences.chinese: 這款精緻炫目的藍寶石鑽石耳環一定令她驚喜不已。

sentences.english: When adorned with national Turkmenian silver decorations, gray horses look stunning.
sentences.chinese: 當裝飾品裝飾與國家土庫曼斯坦銀，灰馬，令人炫目。

sentences.english: From afar, the bold glare of Chinese characters stands out.
sentences.chinese: 站在遠處看，招牌上炫目的中國字非常醒目。

sentences.english: The visual disturbances and blinding headaches were the worst.
sentences.chinese: 視覺障礙和炫目頭疼是最糟糕的。

sentences.english: ''The Legend of 1900'' is at least gorgeous to look at.
sentences.chinese: 當然《海上鋼琴師》至少乍看還是炫目的。
而中華龍鳥的羽毛結構甚至更爲炫目。

sentences.english: Hero topic is one of the most dazzling themes in the spiritual history of contemporary literature.
sentences.chinese: 英雄話題是當代文學精神史上最炫目的主題之一。

sentences.english: Its color is due to ionized hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 它炫目的色彩歸功於電離氫。

sentences.english: Lake Bogoria in Kenya boasts one of the most flamboyant spectacles of the natural world.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼亞的伯哥利亞湖以全自然界最炫目的景觀聞名。

sentences.english: Such a dazzling flower scene exactly shows spring spirit.
sentences.chinese: 這令人炫目的羣花景象正是這春天的精神。

definition: lit. flowing light and overflowing color/brilliant lights and vibrant colors (idiom)
bright and multicolored/of rich variety/(fig.) dazzling/glitzy
